intro: Bartsia laxissima, commonly known as the slender bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a small perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The plant features delicate, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. Bartsia laxissima is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
